question: A and B together can do a piece of work in 10 days. A alone can do it in 30 days. The time in which B alone can do it is :
explanation:
(A+B)\'s 1 day\'s work = $latex \\frac{1}{10}&s=1$
A\'s 1 day\'s work = $latex \\frac{1}{30}&s=1$
âˆ´ B\'s 1 day\'s work = $latex \\frac{1}{10}-\\frac{1}{30}&s=1$
=$latex \\frac{3-1}{30}=\\frac{2}{30}=\\frac{1}{15}&s=1$
Hence, B, alone can complete the work in 15 days
